### Version history

This page provides information about older or alternative versions of  indicative distribution map for this ecosystem functional group [**{{< meta params.efgname >}}**](/efg-info/T2_1.qmd).
Check the current maps [here](/map-info/T2_1_valid.qmd).

- Indicative Map (**code: T2.1.IM.alt**, version v2.1) superceeded 
 - Indicative Map (**code: T2.1.IM.orig**, version v1.0) superceded 
 - Web navigation (**code: T2.1.web.orig**, version v1.0) requires review 

### Datasets

Datasets considered for previous versions of the indicative map

- **Nature-Map-2020** (Jung et al. 2020).
 - **Resolve-Ecoregions-2017** (Dinerstein et al. 2017).

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}


|dataset                 |url                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|:-----------------------|:-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|Nature-Map-2020         |<https://explorer.naturemap.earth/map>{target='links'} :: <https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3666245>{target='links'} :: <https://github.com/Martin-Jung/Habitatmapping>{target='links'} :: <https://uploads.users.earthengine.app/view/habitat-types-map>{target='links'} |
|Resolve-Ecoregions-2017 |<https://ecoregions2017.appspot.com/>{target='links'} :: <https://geospatial.tnc.org/datasets/7b7fb9d945544d41b3e7a91494c42930_0>{target='links'}                                                                                                                       |


:::
:::

### Available files

You can download geospatial data for older versions of these maps from the following sources:

**T2.1.IM.orig** (v1.0): [Zenodo repository (EFG map)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3958622){target="gisdata"}

**T2.1.web.orig** (v1.0): [GitHub repository](https://github.com/red-list-ecosystem/typology-map-data/blob/master/data/layers/T2.1.web.orig_topo.json){target="gisdata"}

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.

###  License information

Indicative maps have been released with a ![](https://zenodo.org/static/icons/licenses/cc-by-icon.svg){height=20} Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license. 

But see details of dataset licenses below:

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}


|dataset                 |license_info                                          |
|:-----------------------|:-----------------------------------------------------|
|Nature-Map-2020         |https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/legalcode |
|Resolve-Ecoregions-2017 |https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/          |


:::
:::

## References

References used in these versions of the maps.

- Martin Jung, Prabhat Raj Dahal, Stuart H. M. Butchart, Paul F. Donald, Xavier De Lamo, Myroslava Lesiv, ... Piero Visconti. (2020). *A global map of terrestrial habitat types* [Data set]. **Zenodo**. DOI: [10.5281/zenodo.3673586](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3673586) 
 - Dinerstein E, Olson D, Joshi A, Vynne C, Burgess ND, Wikramanayake E, Hahn N, Palminteri S, Hedao P, Noss R, Hansen M, Locke H, Ellis EE, Jones B, Barber CV, Hayes R, Kormos C, Martin V, Crist E, Sechrest W, Price L, Baillie JEM, Weeden D, Suckling K, Davis C, Sizer N, Moore R, Thau D, Birch T, Potapov P, Turubanova S, Tyukavina A, de Souza N, Pintea L, Brito JC, Llewellyn Barnekow Lillesø JP, van Breugel P, Graudal L, Voge M, Al-Shammari KF, Saleem M (2017) *An Ecoregion-Based Approach to Protecting Half the Terrestrial Realm*, **BioScience** 67: 534–545. DOI:[10.1093/biosci/bix014](https://doi.org/10.1093/biosci/bix014). [Data-set available on-line](https://ecoregions2017.appspot.com/)
